definition: to join things together by fixing them in place at one or more points/to nail/to pin/to staple/to sew on
nail/to follow closely/to keep at sb (to do sth)/variant of 盯[ding1]

sentences.english: Objective To explore the molluscieidal effect of Areca catechu on Oncomelania hupen-sis.
sentences.chinese: 目的观察槟榔提取物杀灭钉螺的效果。

sentences.english: Moving of oncomelania with dam-break flood is the main cause for spreading schistosomiasis.
sentences.chinese: 采用模型实验对钉螺随溃堤洪水扩散规律进行了研究。

sentences.english: Only 1 infected snail was found in a cement Dou ditch.
sentences.chinese: 在硬化斗渠中仅查出1只感染性钉螺。

sentences.english: The infested rate of snail and density of potive snail will also rise.
sentences.chinese: 滩地钉螺感染率及感染螺密度也将有所上升。

sentences.english: Oncomelania diffusion is the major way of spreading schistosomiasis.
sentences.chinese: 钉螺扩散是血吸虫病传播的最主要途径。

sentences.english: Objective To study the mating behaviour and mode of Oncomelania hupensis hupensis.
sentences.chinese: 目的研究钉螺的交配行为及交配方式。

sentences.english: Conclusion Snail distribution is related with different types of ditch and environment.
sentences.chinese: 结论湖区垸内钉螺分布与渠道类型及不同环境有关。

sentences.english: Conclusion There is ACP in the spreading blood cells of oncomelania hupensis.
sentences.chinese: 结论钉螺血淋巴细胞中的伸展性阿米巴细胞含ACP。

sentences.english: It's concluded that O. hupensis has different phototaxis with different light intensities and colors.
sentences.chinese: 结论钉螺对光强和光色具有不同的趋性反应。

sentences.english: CONCLUSION The pumping water from middle of water body is very effective for prevention of oncomelania snail spread.
sentences.chinese: 目的评估电灌站中层抽水阻止钉螺扩散的效果。

sentences.english: The molluscicidal effect of the plant molluscicide HL to Oncomelania hupensis in laboratory and field investigation.
sentences.chinese: 目的实验室和现场试验评价HL杀灭湖北钉螺的效果。

definition: giant Amazon snail (Ampullaria gigas spix), that has devastated rice paddies in China since its introduction in the 1980s
crab of the family Potamidae of freshwater crabs
mussels/bivalves grown in rivers and lakes
trematoda/fluke/trematode worm, approx 6000 species, mostly parasite, incl. on humans
